variants.Description in input context: This missense variant alters a conserved region of the SNCA protein, potentially affecting its aggregation propensity.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Dopamine Neuron Culture and Aggregation Assay

Material used.Description: Transfected SH-SY5Y cells were used to express SNCA with the identified variant.

Readout description.Result Description: The variant NM_000179.4:c.214A>G significantly increased the formation of Lewy body-like aggregates within the SH-SY5Y cells compared to control cells expressing wild-type SNCA.  Quantitative analysis demonstrated a 3-fold increase in aggregate formation (p<0.01).

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent transfections and analysis were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each condition was analyzed with three independent imaging fields.

Basic positive control.Description: Expression of a known aggregation-promoting SNCA mutant was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector control cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA with Tukey's post-hoc test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Minimal Lewy body-like aggregate formation observed.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Visible and quantifiable increase in Lewy body-like aggregate formation.
